article.headline: Bucknell 73, American U. 59
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Joe Willman scored 13 of his 15 points in the second half and Bucknell never trailed in a 73-59 victory over American on Thursday night. Mike Muscala and Bryson Johnson each added 14 points for the Bison (10-15, 5-4 Patriot League). Muscala scored the first 11 points of the contest. Patrick Behan added 13 points for Bucknell, which grabbed sole possession of fourth place in the conference with its fourth win in five games. Nick Hendra scored 19 points for American (7-17, 4-5), which lost back-to-back league home games for the first time since January 2008 after winning 20 in a row. After opening a 16-3 lead and entering halftime up 28-25, the Bison outscored the Eagles 25-11 to start the second half. Willman had eight points during the spurt to stretch the lead to 51-34. The Eagles were unable to edge closer than 10 points during the remainder of the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
